comment_text: The compound bow made the shot because the stiffer arrow flexed less in flight as the bow is more center shot; less bow to flex around than the longbow. The compound bow was probably faster by 100-150fps too; less arrow drop. Odysseus may not have used a longbow; the Greek word can be translated as "recurved". The recurved bows he may have encountered on his travels include the Scythian, Assyrian, Hittite, Egyptian, and Cretan. He is shown with a Scythian style bow most often in Greek art. With a light enough arrow they could be as fast as the compound bow was. With a stiff enough arrow, less flexing in flight; he could adjust for that too. He was tricky enough to know that even if MythBusters was not. Strong enough to string the bow, tricky enough to know how to set up the shot, good enough to get it done. Odysseus was all three.

Byron Ferguson is probably the most accurate traditional archer on the planet today, if you don’t think so, watch him shoot an aspirin tablet out of the air. However, because the bow is built so far from center, the arrow has to flex around the bow, which is what he means by “archer’s paradox”. However, if we were to put the Odyssey into actual historical possibilities, no bows with shelves were around during whatever time period the tale is told in. So, the only possible way for an arrow to have flown true and straight enough to pass through a dozen rings like this is if it was flying the way an arrow does when fired from an Eastern style bow off the right side. In this method, which is shown in historical Turkish, Korean, and other Asiatic and Eastern methods of shooting, the arrow is shot from the right side of the bow with a thumb draw, which changes the alignment from near the head to the bow, allowing it to fly straight with the addition of “khatra”, which is where upon release of the string the bow is allowed to move to the left with the bow hand, making it so that the arrow doesn’t have to flex around the bow, but fly completely straight to the target.

Technology has advanced to some very high degrees but not beyond facts. They made a mistake when they show the package marked 9mm when the ammo inside of it was long rifle 22 cal. And the gun used in the exercise was a 22 caliber pistol. From the illustration given ,the impact true the bullet did not penstrate the fabric but the inpact caused massive damage
Remember that was a 22 not a 224, 9mm or a 7 mm rifle bullet. Another thing that has to be considered is the shock delivered by the bullet which make contact with the target before the bullet physically make contact. It is this shock that often time delivers the cause of death. Armor has to possess the ability to minimize and obsorb the amount of lethal force. The shock or concentrate energy of a high power bullet alone is enough to decapitate or to kill. Do not leave out known facts and logical expectations.

Regarding that wobble that we see in the arrow, we structural engineers refer to that as "elastic buckling".  The arrow buckles elastically because of the compression force required to accelerate it up to speed.  The arrow continues to wobble throughout its flight because the air doesn't provide enough resistance laterally to dampen the wobble.  Theoretically, one could shoot an arrow without wobble, but here's the catch: the archer would have to "pull" the arrow from the tip, rather than "push" the arrow from the notch.  The bow's string would have to connect to the arrow at the tip.  This doesn't necessarily imply that Byron could make the shot if he had a special bow to "pull" the arrow rather than "push" it.  There's still human error regardless of how the arrow is launched.

"Safa and Marwah are among the symbols set up by God,.... (158 The Heifer)


Prophet Abraham was a native of Iraq.
Acting at God's behest, he took his wife Hajara and his infant son Ismael, and left them in the place now known as Makkah.
There was no habitation there at that time and there was no water.
Thrist forced Hajara to go far afield in search of water.
Distressed, she ran back and forth between the hills of Safa and Marwah.
After seven unsuccessful attempts, she returned to her dwelling. There she found a spring, now known as Zamzam,. This was a symbolic event, showing how Almighty 'God looks after his servents' .
If one persists in the service of God, finally reaching a stage where there is nothing but burning sand beneath one's feet, then God in his mercy will cause a refreshing spring to gush forth from the dryness of the desert sands.

The QURAN translation and commentary by Maulana Wahiduddin Khan
